intro: Zuccarinia ornata, commonly known as the ornate beggar's ticks, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. The plant produces small, bead-like fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is native to parts of Europe and Asia. Zuccarinia ornata is often found growing along stream banks and in woodland areas.
